intro: Sphaeralcea gayana, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the late afternoon. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water storage. Sphaeralcea gayana is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinators.
